info.game_comments: (Jimmy: Hi, I'm Jimmy of the Clue Crew.  Now, I'm not trying to hustle you--but stay tuned for Jeopardy!)

(2, 1).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew kicks things off.)  As the loser of the previous game, I'm doing this to prepare for the break

(3, 1).clue: In Britain, this edible is known as a courgette

(4, 1).clue: Francis won his first Oscar for co-writing this 1970 film biography starring George C. Scott

(5, 1).clue: For him, it was "Goodbye Yellow Brick Road" & hello, godfatherhood to John Lennon's son Sean

(6, 1).clue: This object that projects from a rhino's nose is made from a protein called keratin

(2, 2).clue: (Sofia of the Clue Crew takes her turn.)  In this game named for a black sphere, players aim to sink either the stripes or the solids

(3, 2).clue: People considered this type of ship reliable until the 1930s

(4, 2).clue: This star had a heart attack & was even given last rites while making the 1979 Coppola film "Apocalypse Now"

(5, 2).clue: Michael Jackson can leave his son, Prince Michael, "Home Alone" with this godfather

(6, 2).clue: Like many health-conscious humans, rhinos have this type of diet

(2, 3).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew takes her turn.)  The term for the error I just made has come to refer to any type of mistake

(4, 3).clue: Leonard Maltin said the work of this relative of Francis' was "annoying" in "Peggy Sue Got Married"

(5, 3).clue: The godfather of Madonna's son Rocco is this Police man, who left that musical force in 1984

(6, 3).clue: The rhino is closely related to this animal, though we won't hear "My kingdom for a rhino" anytime soon

(2, 4).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew takes his turn.)  John Carr, a British man, developed this spin technique in the 19th century

(3, 4).clue: There are about 20 species of this popular garden favorite seen here

(4, 4).clue: If you don't know the name of this Coppola-directed 1996 Robin Williams film, then you don't know this title

(5, 4).clue: In 2001 Barry Bonds joined his godfather, this "Say Hey Kid" & fellow S.F. Giant, in the 500-HR club

(6, 4).clue: Except for the Sumatran type, rhinos don't have much of this, except at tail tips or the fringe on the ears

(2, 5).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew wraps things up.)  It's the term for my supporting hand, or for a stick I could use to support the cue

(3, 5).clue: Married name of the 1932 multi-Olympic medal winner seen here

(4, 5).clue: In 1999 Francis produced "The Virgin Suicides", which marked the directorial debut of this woman, his daughter

(5, 5).clue: Winona Ryder could've learned to "turn on, tune in, drop out" from him

(6, 5).clue: People turn into savage rhinos in this Romanian-born author's 1959 play

(1, 1).clue: The haunting "La Casa de los Espiritus"

(2, 1).clue: This vertical, pointy-arched style of 12th-15th century Europe  was revived in the late 18th century

(3, 1).clue: One of these costly disasters hit Northridge, California on January 17, 1994

(4, 1).clue: He's the fictional character who tutors "My Fair Lady"

(5, 1).clue: County General Hospital provides the setting for this current NBC drama series

(6, 1).clue: The name of this cigarette ingredient comes from the ambassador who sent tobacco to Pairs

(2, 2).clue: The simple 18th century British style named for this queen features red brick, not her lace

(3, 2).clue: Seen here, he shot a man in Texas, November 24, 1963

(4, 2).clue: The father of England's King Edward VI

(5, 2).clue: (Sarah & Sofia of the Clue Crew are at an "assembly line".)  We're recreating a classic TV sitcom scene from 1952 featuring these 2 characters

(6, 2).clue: This word for "actor" comes from the father of Greek tragedy

(1, 3).clue: An instrument of Gunter Grass' success, "Die Blechtrommel"

(2, 3).clue: A little house in this early 20th century American "school" has a low-pitched roof & long horizontal lines

(3, 3).clue: Pictured here in happier times, this pair was sentenced to death on April 5, 1951

(4, 3).clue: Trying to reconcile free & slave states in the 1800s, he was the architect of the Missouri Compromise

(5, 3).clue: Until his 1979 death, Jack Soo played Det. Nick Yemana, who made coffee for the 12th Precinct on this sitcom

(6, 3).clue: This mat used on a plate beneath sandwiches & cakes comes from a drapery shop owner

(2, 4).clue: The Byzantine style, mixing east & west, featured domes & these tall towers attached to mosques

(3, 4).clue: During World War II this country surrendered to Allied forces on September 8, 1943

(4, 4).clue: In 1854 this naturalist observed that much of winter is "suggestive of an inexpressable tenderness"

(5, 4).clue: In the fall of 2000, Tim Daly hit the road on an updated version of this series last seen in 1967

(6, 4).clue: An Austrian novelist's name lives on in this tendency in which a person finds pleasure in receiving abuse

(1, 5).clue: The chilling tale "Froken Smillas Fornemmelse For Sne"

(2, 5).clue: Colonial was the American version of this style named for 4 British kings

(3, 5).clue: It was not a merry Christmas for this man on December 25, 1989; his own security forces killed him

(4, 5).clue: At the time of the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor, this man was vice president of the U.S.

(5, 5).clue: Old Ebony, ridden by Chuck Connors in this western, was the grandson of Kentucky Derby winner Flying Ebony

(6, 5).clue: This synonym for "severe" comes from a harsh Athenian lawmaker

(0, 0).clue: Now part of a national recreation area, it was once referred to as "Uncle Sam's Devil's Island"
